edu.ucsc.cross.hse.core.variable

Class DynamicVariable<X>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsc.cross.hse.core.variable.DynamicVariable<X>
  • Type Parameters:
    X - the value type of this variable
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Variable<X>

    public class DynamicVariable<X>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Variable<X>
    A variable that will link with a field of another object and maintain access to the most current value of that field. Intended Operator: User

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.reflect.Field field
      Field corresponding to the specified value of this variable.
      private java.lang.Object source
      Parent object where the value will be modified
      private java.lang.Class<X> valueClass
      The class of the value that this variable accesses.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected DynamicVariable(D data_source, java.lang.String field_name, java.lang.Class<X> state_class)
      Constructor that attempts to find the field to be linked with this variable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      X getValue()
      Get the current value of the variable if it is available, otherwise return null.
      java.lang.Class<X> getValueClass()
      Get the class of the value that this variable accesses.
      static <S,T> DynamicVariable<T> initializeState(S data_source, java.lang.String field_name, java.lang.Class<T> state_class)
      Attempts to construct a dynamic variable and returns null if the variable was not able to be linked to the field.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicVariable

        protected DynamicVariable(D data_source,
                          java.lang.String field_name,
                          java.lang.Class<X> state_class)
        Constructor that attempts to find the field to be linked with this variable. This is not accessible directly since it may not always work, instead the variable is initialized by the static method initializeVariable to handle cases when the field isn't located
        Type Parameters:
        D - class type of the parent data source
        Parameters:
        data_source - parent of the field to be located
        field_name - name of the field to search for
        state_class - class of the field value

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public X getValue()
        Get the current value of the variable if it is available, otherwise return null.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Variable<X>
        Returns:
        value the retrieved value of this variable

      • getValueClass

        public java.lang.Class<X> getValueClass()
        Get the class of the value that this variable accesses.
        Returns:
        valueClass class of the value

      • initializeState

        public static <S,T> DynamicVariable<T> initializeState(S data_source,
                                                       java.lang.String field_name,
                                                       java.lang.Class<T> state_class)
        Attempts to construct a dynamic variable and returns null if the variable was not able to be linked to the field.
        Type Parameters:
        S - class type of the parent data source
        T - class type of the value that is linked to this variable
        Parameters:
        data_source - parent of the field to be located
        field_name - name of the field to search for
        state_class - class of the field value
        Returns:
        dynamicVariable the dynamic variable if it was able to be created, otherwise null
